subject: Gardening
title: Central Park: Democratic Green Space
description: One-minute skill: Central Park: Democratic Green Space.

hook.text: Central Park looks natural. Every rock placement, every meadow, every lake was designed from scratch.

buildup.text: Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux won the 1857 design competition with their 'Greensward Plan.'

discovery.text: They moved 10 million cartloads of earth, planted 270,000 trees, and created lakes from swampland.

twist.text: The 'natural' park required more engineering than many cities. Four sunken roadways keep traffic invisible.

climax.text: Central Park proved that designed nature could serve democracyâ€”a free green space for every citizen.

punchline.text: America's most natural park is entirely man-made.

quiz.question: What engineering innovation did Olmsted include in Central Park?
options: Underground heating systems for year-round garden blooms
Four sunken roadways that keep traffic invisible from the park
A canal system connecting every lake and pond
